summary: This bill, the "TOO LATE Act," proposes amendments to the Federal Reserve Act concerning the removal of the Chairman of the Board of Governors. It allows the President to remove the Chairman if the Federal funds target rate deviates significantly from certain economic benchmarks for two consecutive quarters. The bill outlines procedures for the President to justify such removal, including a statement to Congress, and mandates Congressional hearings to analyze the justification. It also defines the 'Federal funds target rate.'
